alert.note: Alert for City of Danville; Pittsylvania (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 8:05AM EST until January 11 at 2:00PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina...Virginia... Dan River near Danville affecting Pittsylvania, City of Danville, Caswell and Rockingham independent cities. .Several inches of rain fell Tuesday into Wednesday. Excessive runoff on saturated ground continues to cause minor flooding along the lower portion of the Dan and the Roanoke River basins. For the Dan River...including Wentworth, Danville, Dan River at Paces, South Boston...Minor flooding is forecast to continue. At 800 AM EST, the stage was 22.8 feet. Flood stage is 21.0 ft. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Dan River near STP near Danville. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, The road at Trade Street is closed and the parking lot at Newton`s landing begins to flood. At 21.0 feet, Flooding begins at River District Towers. Minor flooding along River Street begins. At 23.0 feet, Flooding begins to affect Riverside shopping center. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM EST Thursday the stage was 22.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 17.0 feet. - The river crested earlier today at 22.9 ft and has begun to fall slowly. The stage at 700 am EST this morning was 22.8 ft. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain above flood stage through this evening, then drop below flood stage after 8 pm EST this evening. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - For additional information please visit our web site located at http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. this afternoon at 200 PM EST.
